review_blob: A special seasonal brew, eagerly awaited by us locals. Orange, slight cloud, minimal head. Sweet tangy and a great beginning of summer beer.
Nice tart sweetness tickles your tongue.  Cloudy yellow orange with a small tight head. Tasty with slight lasting bitter finish.
Big hop hit up front with aroma, then taste. Nice clear orange, minimal head. Lingering hop hit. Did I say hops and more hops?
beer_name: Flat Tail Licentious Goat Herbed Double IPA

review_blob: Cloudy orange, slight white head dissipates quickly. Starts with anice floral hop flavor goes to nice citrus notes. Well balanced. Deep hop bitterness finsih. Sitting at Amnesia on a nice sunny day watching the people walk by.
Light cream head, dark brown opaque, great lacing. Mild aroma. Smooth, slight bite. Mild hop. Roasty.
beer_name: Stone / The Alchemist / Ninkasi More Brown than Black IPA

review_blob: Clear, light brown, minimal head. Mild aroma, sweet carmel, acidic. Slick light after taste. Light refreshing.
found this in a box in the cellar. It had malt forward with some hops. Nice brown-orange and still drinkable. Refreshing break from big IPAs.

New bottle in Wine & Beer Haus, Seaside Oregon.  I was looking for a special beer for my 1111th beer since 2002 in their Hall of Foam Club.  Wow.  Pours with a nice dark head.  Has the chocolate & spice aroma, Tastes like a wonderful high end Stout w chocolate.  builds up flavor as it warms up.  A perfect beer for the occasion.
beer_name: Midnight Sun T.R.E.A.T. Imperial Chocolate Pumpkin Porter

review_blob: Good clear amber, nice hops in the nose, good malt and hop balance, nice beer from the 8 pack of 7 oz. bottles.  Had it following Keberos.  A much bigger beer and nice malt finish to hop-s up front.
beer_name: Flying Dog Double Dog Double Pale Ale

review_blob: My Christmas gift pack had this.  A nice take on a Belgian beer.  Sweet, clear, nice and smooth .
A canned beer for sipping OUT OF THE CAN into a snifter, let it warm up and enjoy. Caramel, herbs, chocolate, nice body, and great flavor.  A grat beer to drink.
Big wood, chocolate, thick, moderate to heavy alcohol, a great sipping beer.  Had oone of my case of XI tonight.  This will continue to age well.
This is a serious beer that changes as you slowly sip while working.  It starts out sweet and nice gets more bitters and roasty as the session goes on.
beer_name: Mad River Serious Madness Black Ale

review_blob:
Fort George BrewPub has a keg of this wonderful beer.  They served it with the main course at their Collaboration Dinner featuring Belgian beers and seafood courses created by guest chefs.

The executive chef for the local school district food service created a ling cod stuffed with fresh razor clams served with sauteed chard and croquette potatoes.  The Christmas Ale balance well with this main course.

This is a really special malty, high gravity beer that matched well with the rich razor clams.

This is an interesting herbal beer.   It pours with an average head that is frothy with fair lacing.  It is a clear amber.  There is a light malt hit, no yeast odors and no herbal odor that one might expect from basil.   It is light palate with moderate carbonation.  The taste of honey is light with a moderate bittnerness and slight herbal hint.   A nice beer for a sunset hot tub session.

This January 2005 seasonal has aged well.   And the 2006 version is due for release on January 1.  A deep black that blocks the sun when held to the evenng sunset with a large creamy brown head.   This is big on roasted coffee aroma with hints of smoke.   The aging in wine barrels smooths out the flavor which has some chocolate tones and the expresso in a bottle hit.  Not too heavy hop bitterness and a medium body.   This will be a great beer for vertical tastings that should be able to age several years.
beer_name: Golden Valley Black Panther - Wine Barrel

review_blob: On December 6 a group of 14 started a vertical tasting of these beers four from the current era and two from Hurlimann.  The 2004 needs more time in the bottle.  It had a good brown sugar flavor, characteristic alcohol bite, hints of raisin and a nice orange color.  2003 had a similar orange color with no head and little lacing.  There was caramel hints in the aroma port and toffee flavors.  This one can use more time in the bottle also.  No one in the Wine and Beer Haus group had 2002 left.  2001 poured a red brown aroma had caramel, molasses, and toffee.  This one had the strongest alcohol bite and an astringence.  My least favorite of the new era.  2000 is developing nicely.  It pours a nice brown, clear, with little head or lacing.  It has a heavy malt aroma with raisin, toffee, butterscoths, mapel   yrup, and bronw sugar notes.  A medium body and lisck alcoholic plate.  This one may reach the heights of the 1996

On December 6 a group of 14 started a vertical tasting of these beers four from the current era and two from Hurlimann.  The 1996 was rated the best.  The 1997 does not seem to be aging as well.  These beers poured with little head and lacing.  They were clear deep brown.  They did not have a big aroma.  They did have medium body, heavy sweetness and alcohol bite.  The flavors were stron prune, toffe, maple syrup, and vanilla.  Like drinking a rich port.

This one poured with a small light brown head.  It had little lacing, was clear and a ruby color.  The aroma was light ot average with minimal hop, yeast, or alchohol.  It had a light body. soft carbonation and mild malty flavor that was of short duration, moderatley sweet and a light yeasty after taste.

I expect a beer named "hoppy" to have hops.  This one had mild evrythng.  Aroma, malt, and lite hops.  There was a great head frothy and white.  Good clear orange color.  And a nice orange flavor with a hint of malt and hops.  

This could be a lite session beer excpet for the 7% alcohol

Had this last night at a friends house along with another Potland Brewed IPA.  This one poured better than the other.  It had a ligth amber color, a good head that was creamy white and had fair lacing.   

This one had a good hop aroma light malt and a slight citrus.

The plate was medium a little slick and good bitter finish.

The flavor was what Ive come to expect from Bridgeport and good strong hop hit that lingers and a nice finish that has a modetate duration.  This is a good beer to keep on had for a Saturday afternoon session.

beer_brewer_name: Portland Brewing Company (Pyramid - North American Breweries)
review_blob:
This was a new IPA to me.  I used to live very close to Elk Rock and at that time there were no beers named after it.  This one is a light amber, clear IPA with a small head.

The aroma is light and has minimal hop.

This is a thin beer modest hop taste and little malt.  A starter IPA.  It his a short aftertaste and modest bitterness.

This poured with a small head that did not last and had minimal lacing.  It had a toffee aroma and was a thick soft palate.  

The flavor was a good malt hop balance.  Starting with good sweeetness and moderate bitterness.  

This is from a brewery about 90 minutes away and is available at our local bottle shop.
